result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James C. Livermore

records.addlTxt:
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney 
(2)

ADDRESS INFO for James C. Livermore
Current: 1313 5th Ave., Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 415 Apt A Edison St, Antigo, WI 54409 United States

1:47 PM/ RM 301. Defendant James C. Livermore in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has filed petition for appointment of counsel, was granted. Court questions if Def. has received order. Def. has not yet received. Court orders Def. to update address with Clerk's office. Court will modify order, Def. to pay $500.00 down payment by November 1st, 2022 and $400 per month to begin on December 1st, 2022. Court advises Def. of right to P.H. within time limits and questions if Def. would like to waive time limits. Def. wishes to wait for counsel and waives time limits on P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
(2)

2:48 PM Defendant James C. Livermore in court.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has filed petition for court appointed Atty. Court will be granting petition. $850.00 Down payment due by October 10th, 2022. Def. to pay $412.50 per month. State is in compliance with victim rights. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Routed to Judge's JA & CC's JA
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for James C. Livermore
Current: 415 Apt A Edison St, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 820 Fulton Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No domestic abuse or violence.

3:45 PM Defendant James C. Livermore in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own or court appointed Atty or represent self. Def. wishes to have counsel and has contacted the PD office, does not qualify. Waiting to hear back from another Atty. State is in compliance with victim rights. State makes bond recommendations and requests $2,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, no contact with victim or victims residence. Def. makes statement regarding bond. Court questions Def. employment. Alleged victim is present in courtroom and Court questions victim regarding bond. Victim makes statement in court. State replies. Court questions victim regarding contact with victim witness coordinator. Court considers factors and orders cash bond remain at $1,150.00 with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Court questions victim regarding no contact order. Court allows Def. to remain at residence with conditions of no domestic abuse or violence.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
